intro: Stadtmannia oppositifolia, commonly known as the opposite-leaved Stadtmannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other valuable timber trees. The plant is characterized by its opposite leaf arrangement and small, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
